title: ONYX STORM
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.

title: SCYTHE & SPARROW
author: Brynne Weaver
description: The third book in the Ruinous Love series. A circus motorcycle performer involved in devious exploits gets close to a doctor.

title: DEEP END
author: Ali Hazelwood
description: As the pressure leading up to the Olympics builds so do the feelings Lukas and Scarlett have for each other.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: PARANOIA
author: James Patterson and James O. Born
description: The 17th book in the Michael Bennett series. Bennett goes after someone who is killing police officers.

title: OUTLIVE
author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

title: ON TYRANNY
author: Timothy Snyder
description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: SOURCE CODE
author: Bill Gates
description: The philanthropist and co-founder of Microsoft describes events from his childhood and his discovery of computers.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: HOW WE LEARN TO BE BRAVE
author: Mariann Edgar Budde

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: AWAY
author: Megan E. Freeman
description: A group of children in a relocation camp investigate why they were driven from their homes. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: LITTLE LEADERS
author: Vashti Harrison
description: The biographies of 40 African-American women who made a difference. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: LITTLE LEGENDS: EXCEPTIONAL MEN IN BLACK HISTORY
author: Vashti Harrison with Kwesi Johnson
description: Biographies of trailblazing Black men. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: LITTLE BLUE TRUCK'S VALENTINE
author: Alice Schertle. Illustrated Jill McElmurry
description: Little Blue Truck delivers Valentine's Day cards to all his farm animal friends. (Ages 4 and up)

title: LOVE FROM BLUEY
author: Suzy Brumm
description: The love between parents and their children. (Ages 5 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A LOVEOSAURUS
author: Alice Walstead. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: The Catch Club Kids attempt to catch a dinosaur that wants to spread love and kindness. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: LOVE FROM THE VERY HUNGRY CATERPILLAR
author: Eric Carle
description: A ravenous insect returns with its appetite intact. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: IN MY HEART
author: Jo Witek. Illustrated Christine Roussey
description: An exploration of feelings. (Ages 2 to 4)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT
author: Allison Saft
description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: THE ROSE BARGAIN
author: Sasha Peyton Smith
description: Ivy Benton enters a competition to win the hand of Prince Bram. (Ages 13 and up)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME
author: Laura Nowlin
description: The coming-of-age love story of Autumn and Phineas. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: HEARTLESS HUNTER
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)
